overview: The purpose and intent of this measure is to appropriate moneys for the Judiciary for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027 (HB400_SD2_SSCR1841_.PDF.txt). As amended, the bill makes operating appropriations from general funds of $198,782,736 (HB400_SD2_SSCR1841_.PDF.txt) for FY 2025-2026 and $198,855,327 (HB400_SD2_SSCR1841_.PDF.txt) for FY 2026-2027. The measure now also includes a capital improvements appropriation of $12,900,000 (HB400_SD2_SSCR1841_.PDF.txt) in general obligation bond funds for FY 2025-2026.
appropriations: This measure, as amended, makes the following appropriations (HB400_SD2_SSCR1841_.PDF.txt): Operating general funds of $198,782,736 (HB400_SD2_SSCR1841_.PDF.txt) for Fiscal Year 2025-2026 and $198,855,327 (HB400_SD2_SSCR1841_.PDF.txt) for Fiscal Year 2026-2027. Capital Improvements appropriations include $12,900,000 (HB400_SD2_SSCR1841_.PDF.txt) in general obligation bond funds for Fiscal Year 2025-2026. The legislative document specifies that of the general fund appropriation for administration (JUD601), the sum of $1,000,000 (HB400_SD2_.HTM.txt) shall be expended for civil legal services and the sum of $750,000 (HB400_SD2_.HTM.txt) shall be expended on legal services for individuals in immigration-related proceedings in immigration court for each fiscal year.
agency_impact: The Judiciary's operating resource requests center around funding to make permanent or expand three Specialty Courts on O‘ahu, to fully staff the new Wahiawā District Court, and to add an additional District Court Judge and support staff in Kona. Testimony indicates a request of $705,416 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) in FY 2026 and $705,416 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) in FY 2027 to establish a permanent Women’s Court. Additional requests support cybersecurity and technology costs, funding for the Criminal Justice Research Institute (CJRI), and restoration of funding for essential staffing.
policy_impact: The Committee has amended this measure by "Changing the effective date to July 1, 2050, to facilitate further discussion on the measure" (HB400_SD2_SSCR1841_.PDF.txt).
revenue_sources: Appropriations are made from general funds and general obligation bond funds. The legislative document specifies that capital improvement projects will be financed through the issuance of general obligation bonds, and the sum total so issued "shall not exceed $12,900,000" (HB400_SD2_.HTM.txt).
six_year_fiscal_implications: Testimony indicates the Judiciary requests additional operating resources of $6.17M in FY 2026, and $6.25M in FY 2027 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt). Specific requests include funding to make the DWI Court Program permanent at a cost of $232,412 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) in FY 2026 and $237,612 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) in FY 2027. An additional District Court Judge in Kona and support staff are requested for $368,943 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) in FY 2026 and $360,048 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) in FY 2027. Cybersecurity requests include $1,175,300 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) in FY 2026 and $1,175,300 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) to upgrade email subscriptions. Funding requests for the Criminal Justice Research Institute include $512,624 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) in FY 2026 and $577,058 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) for a permanent Project Specialist position and software. Five requests relate to the new Wahiawā District Court, including one to restore funding for three positions at $192,408 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) in FY 2026 and $192,408 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) for adult client services. The Judiciary also requests $151,000 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) in FY 2026 and $151,000 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) to cover an increase in risk management costs.
capital_expenditure_impact: The legislative document specifies the sum of $12,900,000 (HB400_SD2_.HTM.txt) is appropriated for capital improvement projects. Testimony indicates the Judiciary is requesting $4.0 million (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) to design a new South Kohala District Courthouse and requests $900,000 (HB400_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-31-25_.PDF.txt) to replace an A/C chiller on Kaua‘i. The legislative document also appropriates $8,000,000 (HB400_SD2_.HTM.txt) for "LUMP SUM CIP FOR JUDICIARY FACILITIES, STATEWIDE" (HB400_SD2_.HTM.txt).
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The committee has amended the measure by "Clarifying operating and capital improvement project amounts" (HB400_SD2_SSCR1841_.PDF.txt). The measure, as amended, makes operating appropriations from general funds totaling $198,782,736 (HB400_SD2_SSCR1841_.PDF.txt) for FY 2025-2026 and adds a new capital improvements appropriation of $12,900,000 (HB400_SD2_SSCR1841_.PDF.txt) in general obligation bond funds. The effective date has been changed to July 1, 2050, "to facilitate further discussion on the measure" (HB400_SD2_SSCR1841_.PDF.txt).
